section.title: Hardware Requirements
section.para: The Enabler doesn't change the &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Hardware Requirements, refer to &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE documentation for more information.

section.title: Software Prerequisites
section.para: The Enabler requires that &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE is properly set, with the Diameter Base and Sh-Client Resource Adaptors deployed.

section.title: &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE &THIS.ENABLER; Enabler Source Code
section.para: This section provides instructions on how to obtain and build the &THIS.ENABLER; Enabler from source code.

step.title: Downloading the source code

important.para: Git is used to manage Mobicents JAIN SLEE source code. Instructions for downloading, installing and using Git can be found at

step.para: Use Git to checkout a specific release source from the Git repository URL at &THIS.SOURCE_CODE_URL;. Choose the appropriate release version like in the follow example: &THIS.VERSION;.

step.title: Building the source code

important.para: Maven 2.0.9 (or higher) is used to build the release. Instructions for using Maven2, including install, can be found at

step.para: Use Maven to build the deployable unit binary.

Once the build is completed, you should have the deployable-unit jar file in the target directory. If &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE is installed and environment variable JBOSS_HOME is pointing to its underlying &JEE.PLATFORM; directory, the deployable unit jar will also be deployed in the container.

section.title: Uninstalling &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE &THIS.ENABLER; Enabler
section.para: To uninstall the Enabler simply execute provided ant script build.xml undeploy target:
The script will delete the Enabler's deployable unit jar from the default &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE server/default/deploy directory, to undeploy from another server profile use the argument -Dnode=.
